p: On March 13, 2020, the first case of COVID-19 was confirmed in Kenya. In response, national guidelines were enacted to prevent its spread. Clinics and HIV programs were faced with the challenge of balancing the safety of staff with healthcare needs of the community. Here we report the impact of COVID-19 on clinics providing aPS services in western Kenya using programmatic data to assess trends over time and conversations with in-country staff to explore perspectives and challenges associated with aPS provision during COVID-19.
